messages.body:
$CAJ  This company is now selling for well below book value.  It's low debt and healthy current ratio make me think it is in little danger of going under anytime soon.   
 
Does it have a wealth of compelling products?  Depends.  
 
Is the camera industry booming?  I would say no.  When I search for laser printers online by reviewer ratings, the answer would again be no. 
 
Companies that are sitting on healthy books with incompetent leadership tend to be taken over and gutted or broken up.  Shareholders would probably welcome even a hostile offer, just to get rid of current management.   
 
I don't like to sell assets that are below book value so I'll stick around and collect the dividends a little longer.
